name: carburetion
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of mixing fuel and air to produce the gas that is burned to provide power for operating a vehicle or machine: The carburetor mixes the fuel with air by carburetion. Poor carburetion meant the boat was operating far below its normal speed. His high-speed motor led to the development of the process of carburation to utilize liquid fuels.
More examplesFewer examplesHe loved tinkering with cars and discussing subjects like ignition, carburetion, and gearing.We have seen an increase in problems with carburetion, fuel lines, and fuel pumps since the new fuel was introduced.When you drive above 60 miles per hour, the carburetion system in most cars is less efficient.
